div.l: Foure gledes haue we wich I shal deuise
Auaunting · lyeng angir and Couetise
These iiij sparcles longith to the elde
Oure olde lymes mowe wel be vnwelde
But will ne shal nat faile that is soth
And yit I haue alwey a Coltes toth
As many a yere as it is passed henne
Sith that my toppe of lif began to renne
For sikerli whan I was born anon̄
Deth drouȝ the tappe of lif and lete it gon̄
And euer sith hath the tappe I ronne
Til that almost all empti is the tonne
The strem of lif now droppeth on the
The sely tonge may wel rynge and chymbe
Of wrecchidnesse that is I passed ful yore
With olde folk saue dotage is nomore
Whan that oure oost had herd this sermoning
He gan to speke as lordly as doth a king
He seid what amounteth all this wit
What shull we speke alday of holi writt
The deuell made a Reue for to preche
Or of a Souter shipman or Leche
Sey forth thi tale and tarie nat the tyme
Loo depford and it is half wey prime
Lo Grenewich that many a shrewe is inne
It were all tyme thi tale for to beginne
Now Sirs quod Oswald the Reue
I pray you that ye nouȝt you greue
Thouȝ I can ansuere and somdel set his howe
With lefull is with force forto showe
This dronken Millere hath I tolde vs hiere
Hou that ther beguiled was a Carpentere
Parauenture in scorn̄ for ik am oon̄
And be your leue I shal him quite anon̄
Riȝt in his cherles termes wol I speke
I pray to god his necke mot to breke
He can wel in myn yhe seen a stalke
But in his ougne he can̄ nat sene a balke

Hiere endeth the prolog of the
Reue
with his tale folwing .

At Trompington
nat fer fro Cambrigge /

Ther
goth a brook and ouer that a brigge
Vpon̄ wich brook stant a mylle
And this is verri soth that I you telle
A Millere was there duelling many aday
As any Pecok he was proude and gay
Pipe he coude fisshe and nettes bete
And torne cuppes and wel wrastele ⁊and shete
Ay be his belte he bar a long Panade
And of a swerd full trenchaunt was the blade
A ioly popper bar he in his pouche
Ther durst no man̄ for perill him touche
A sheffeld twytell bar he in his hose
Round was his face and camuse was his nose
And piled as an ape was his sculle
He was a market beter ate fulle
Ther durst no wiȝt hand vpon̄ him legge
That he ne swoor he shuld anon̄ abegge
A theef was he forsothe of corn ⁊and mele
And that asly and an vsant for to stele
His name was hote Deynous Symkyn̄
A wif he had comen̄ of noble kyn̄
The Person of the toun her fader was
With her he yaf full many a panne a brass
For that Symkyn shuld in his blood allie
She was I fosterid in a Nonnerie
For Symkyn wold no wif as he seide
But she were well I norisshed and a maide
To saue worship and yomanrie
And she was proude and pert as is a pye
A full faire siȝt was it vpon̄ hem tuo
On halidayes beforn hir wold he go
With his tipett wounde aboute his hed
And she come aftir in a gyte of red
And Symkyn had hosen of the same
Ther durst no wiȝt clepe hir but dame
Was non so hardy that went by the way
That with hir durst ones rage or pleye
But if he wolde be slain of Symkyn̄
With Panade with knif or Boydekyn̄
